span.p: We recognize the stress our students are facing while trying to learn in a completely new way and without the traditional classroom they have become so accustomed to. We know that our students rely on the supports given in a traditional school day and as a result it makes it more difficult for students to achieve as they normally would in a face-to-face setting.
In an effort to make this time as equitable as reasonably possible we will be implementing the following:

ul.li: Teachers will continue to give students traditional grades on their assignments for the fourth quarter, but the overall fourth-quarter grade will be satisfactory/unsatisfactory.

GPA calculations were frozen as of March 13, 2020. This was the last date we could show reasonable equity. Satisfactory/unsatisfactory courses will not impact GPA, but will allow students to earn credits toward graduation.

Students enrolled in dual credit courses will follow the requirements of the college or university affiliated with the course. If you have questions regarding these courses please check with your guidance counselor.
Students will be expected to keep up with their assigned work and communicate regularly with their teachers.

span.p: We want to be fair and understanding to our students as we realize each family situation is unique and each personal learning environment is not the same. As we progress closer to the end of the school year, we will need to be flexible and understanding. The plans we made months ago will need to adapt to our current health needs and requirements. We will always work hard for our students and community and appreciate your continued support.
